intro: Melilotus melilotus-tauricus, commonly known as the tall melilot, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its trifoliate leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas. Melilotus melilotus-tauricus is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a forage crop.
